pullRequest.title: Pre-init static qtype fields
pullRequest.bodyText:
Pre-init static qtype fields
Add static qtype fields to the FCC. Pre-verifify, prepare and init all
static qtype fields.
Reuse the existing classloading stack (used for classloading circularity
errors) and make it more generic so it can be reused to detect circular
verification issues.
For example:
inline class A { static B b; }
inline class B { static A a; }

The recursive definition of static fields above would trigger a stack overflow in verification if the cycle is not detected. The verification stack detects the classes that are currently being verified so we can avoid re-verification in these cases.
Determine offsets of all flattenable fields during class linkage, JIT
needs to know the offsets as early as possible.
Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila atobia@ca.ibm.com

nodes.bodyText: I'd prefer the sides of the & to be inverted here.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1708,6 +1713,8 @@ typedef struct J9FlattenedClassCache {
 
 #define J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_FROM_FCC(flattenedClassCache, index) (((J9FlattenedClassCacheEntry *)((flattenedClassCache) + 1)) + (index))
 #define J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_FROM_CLASS(clazz, index) J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_FROM_FCC((clazz)->flattenedClassCache, index)
+#define J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FROM_ENTRY(entry) ((J9Class *)(~J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_MASK & (UDATA)(entry)->clazz))

nodes.bodyText: This could use the any/all bittest macros, and the inner mask is unnecessary (the static bit is necessarily a subset of all of the flag bits).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1708,6 +1713,8 @@ typedef struct J9FlattenedClassCache {
 
 #define J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_FROM_FCC(flattenedClassCache, index) (((J9FlattenedClassCacheEntry *)((flattenedClassCache) + 1)) + (index))
 #define J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_FROM_CLASS(clazz, index) J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_FROM_FCC((clazz)->flattenedClassCache, index)
+#define J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FROM_ENTRY(entry) ((J9Class *)(~J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_MASK & (UDATA)(entry)->clazz))
+#define J9_VM_FCC_ENTRY_IS_STATIC_FIELD(entry) (J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_STATIC_FIELD == ((J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_MASK & ((UDATA)(entry)->clazz)) & J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_STATIC_FIELD))

@@ -1695,6 +1695,11 @@ typedef struct J9ModuleExtraInfo {
  *                    |                       |                *
  *      clazz N       |   Name & Signature N  |     offset N   *
  ***************************************************************/
+
+#define J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_MASK ((UDATA) 0xFF)
+#define J9_VM_FCC_CLASS_FLAGS_STATIC_FIELD ((UDATA)0x1)
+
+

@@ -2251,6 +2280,18 @@ fieldOffsetsStartDo(J9JavaVM *vm, J9ROMClass *romClass, J9Class *superClazz, J9R
 fieldOffsetsStartDo(J9JavaVM *vm, J9ROMClass *romClass, J9Class *superClazz, J9ROMFieldOffsetWalkState *state, U_32 flags);
 #endif
 
+/**
+ * Initialize fields offsets into FCC
+ *
+ *

@@ -2264,6 +2305,19 @@ fieldOffsetsStartDo(J9JavaVM *vm, J9ROMClass *romClass, J9Class *superClazz, J9R
 void
 defaultValueWithUnflattenedFlattenables(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9Class *clazz, j9object_t instance);
 
+/**
+ * Initialize static fields to default values when the class
+ * contains flattenable statics. Currently non of the static fields are flattened.

nodes.bodyText: If the types here are both void*, there's no need for the casting. Function could be a single line (if TRUE and FALSE aren't identical to the C comparison results, we're in trouble).
If you think there will be multiple static fields, might be worth moving this out of the loop.
classTableMutex isn't a good name for a boolean.
This can't GC, so it doesn't need to push/pop/currentclass code.
This can't GC, so doesn't need the push/pop/current protections.
Why is this not an error?

nodes.bodyText: Please update name to match the code.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -431,6 +431,35 @@ contendedLoadTableFree(J9JavaVM* vm);
  */
 #define J9_CP_INDEX_NONE -1
 
+/**
+ * Checks stack to see if element exists, if not adds the new element and returns TRUE. Otherwise, returns FALSE
+ *
+ * @param vmThread vmthread token
+ * @param classloader loader associated with current element
+ * @param clazz either romclass or ramclass
+ * @param stack the loading or linking stack
+ * @param comparator handle to function that will compare elements
+ * @param maxStack maximum concurrent classloads or class linkage
+ * @param stackpool pool for stack elements
+ * @param throwException flag to indicate if exception should be thrown in the case of cirularity
+ * @param classTableMutex flag to indicate if class table mutex is being held
